title: Whispers Tied in Knots
description: The Whisperfen upriver drinks sound and memory. Serene tasks Raithe to accompany Tallen Quill, a vow-scribe with ink that glows when truth is near, to meet the ferryman Keth Borrowed-Tongue. House Veyron’s marriage oath is whispered to be altered—its true clause might still float in the marsh’s borrowed voices. The river narrows and the reeds begin to listen; bog-lights mimic lantern codes, trying to lure skiffs into drinking pools. Keth poles a narrow boat through blackwater, speaking only in other people’s words, while white egrets stitch pale threads across the sky. The marsh remembers many nights; Raithe must persuade it to replay the right one without it swallowing his own past in payment.
objectives: Find Keth Borrowed-Tongue at the Whisperfen’s outlanding and secure passage.
Use knot-charms to bind a question into the reeds: the night of House Veyron’s marriage contract.
Defend Tallen Quill from thought-leeches and false lantern codes while the fen replays the memory.
Retrieve a memory-knot charm that preserves the unaltered clause.

dialogue.speaker: Keth Borrowed-Tongue
dialogue.line: ‘Greetings, honored travelers. Mind your hands, they will be bitten by the past if they hang over the gunwales.’ That is what the last ferryman said, and I keep his words. ‘You are searching for a night that changed a house and a city; the fen drank it gladly.’ But you must promise it something it cannot spit back to you, or it will ask for your very first lullaby.

dialogue.speaker: Tallen Quill
dialogue.line: My ink warms when a falsehood passes near; if we can coax the fen to unspool the vow, I can write its true teeth onto unburnable parchment. But I am no fighter, Raithe. Keep the bog-lights out of my eyes and the leeches off my throat, and I will keep my scratch straight.

dialogue.speaker: Raithe Calder
dialogue.line: I’ve bled on cobbles and on chain, scribe, and I’ll bleed on peat if I must. Keth, I will not feed the marsh my name or my mother’s song. Bind this question to my knot-ring instead and let the fen taste brass if it wants payment. If it speaks with my father’s voice, I’ll hold fast.

dialogue.speaker: Serene Khel
dialogue.line: Do not wrestle the past, only invite it. The fen may echo a night when a prince said one thing and meant another, and my Order will need that echo to be set before the Parliament. Tie your courage as you tie your knots: firm, but not strangling.

items: Memory-knot charm bearing the true clause
Reed-paper writ authorizing testimony at the Glass Parliament

faction.name: Order of Mnemos
faction.favor: One sealed question may be posed in a future rite without tithe of days.

unlock: Keth’s private channels through the Whisperfen for future travel.
